Column1: Bhuvneshwar to Boult, out Caught by Shami!! Short ball outside off, climbs on Boult as he slashes at it and flies off the top-edge down to third man. Shami dawdles in and cups it comfortably. India seal the series 4-1. Boult c Shami b Bhuvneshwar 1(3)
Hardik Pandya to Matt Henry, no run, good response from Pandya, getting it right in the blockhole outside off, Henry doesn't manage to lay a bat on it

Hardik Pandya to Matt Henry, SIX, now this is a nothing ball from Pandya. Slower one dug into the pitch, sits up for Henry who hacks it over square leg, even more convincing than the previous one if that's even possible
Hardik Pandya to Matt Henry, SIX, short ball outside off, Henry bulldozes this pull over cow corner, much like Pandya had done himself earlier in the day. Just brute power
Hardik Pandya to Boult, 1 run, yorker at the stumps, jammed down to long-on
Hardik Pandya to Boult, no run, back of a length delivery outside off, Boult wafts at it flat-footed and is beaten on the edge

Hardik Pandya to Santner, out Caught by Shami!! Santner has flicked a leg-stump half-volley straight into the hands of short fine leg. He can't believe it. Not that Pandya, with a sheepish smile, can believe it either. Should be game over for New Zealand. Santner c Shami b Hardik Pandya 22(37)
Chahal to Matt Henry, no run, flighted up outside off, driven to cover
Chahal to Matt Henry, no run, a slip was added before this delivery, which was a bluff for Chahal to slip the wrong 'un in. Henry doesn't fall for it and keeps it out
Chahal to Santner, 1 run, flighted googly outside off, Santner stretches out and drives to long-off
Chahal to Santner, 2 runs, flat on leg, turning back into Santner who whips it wide of deep midwicket. Placement is good enough for two
Chahal to Santner, no run, this time he beats him for bounce. Extra lift with the googly, Santner misses out on the cut again
Chahal to Santner, no run, sharply skids through from a length outside off, beats Santner for pace on the cut
Shami to Matt Henry, FOUR, clears the front leg to a slower ball and tonks it over mid-off. Wow, not the kind of treatment Shami was expecting from a No.10
Shami to Matt Henry, no run, cracking yorker that bends in on middle and leg, Henry's able to dig it out
Shami to Santner, 1 run, full toss on off, driven down to long-on
Shami to Santner, no run, full toss outside off, it travels rapidly off Santner's bat as he slashes at it, but it's straight to backward point. Unlucky with that
Shami to Matt Henry, 1 run, short of length delivery outside off, slapped to sweeper cover
Shami to Santner, 1 run, yorker length outside off, squeezed down to long-on
Chahal to Matt Henry, no run, snakes into off stump with a wrong 'un, Henry picks it and defends

Chahal to Todd Astle, out Lbw!! Beaten on the sweep shot by this googly. It's given out onfield, but was it turning too much? Astle might have a good shot with this review. Or maybe not. The umpire is spot on. It would've crashed into the top of leg stump. Todd Astle lbw b Chahal 10(16) [4s-1]
Chahal to Santner, 1 run, flighted googly on leg stump, Santner sweeps it to deep square leg. Wanted to go big with it, but didn't get hold
Chahal to Todd Astle, 1 run, sliding in on leg stump, clipped through square leg
Chahal to Santner, 1 run, back of a length on middle, punched down to long-off. "Aage, aage (keep it fuller)" is the call from Dhoni
Chahal to Santner, 2 runs, length ball skidding across off, Santner cracks it off the back foot through extra cover
Shami to Santner, 1 run, slower off-cutter outside off, Santner was looking to drive over the cover region but all he manages is a thick outside edge that runs down to third man
Shami to Santner, no run, cannoned into the blockhole outside off, jammed out to backward point
Shami to Santner, no run, slower ball that's overpitched outside off, Santner drills it straight to mid-off
Shami to Santner, no run, back of a length delivery just outside off, a cutter at 126kph, Santner pats it to backward point
Shami to Todd Astle, 1 run, good length delivery outside off, punched to sweeper cover
Shami to Todd Astle, 2 runs, good length ball outside off, driven crisply on the up through extra cover. Actually the timing may have not been there as he got it close to the toe-end
Kedar Jadhav to Santner, no run, fired in close to the blockhole at 90kph, Santner jams it to cover
Kedar Jadhav to Todd Astle, 1 run, nice use of the feet, gets to the pitch of this flighted ball and pushes down to long-off
Kedar Jadhav to Todd Astle, no run, short ball outside off, another opportunity for Astle to look for the gap. But this time he cuts it to Chahal at cover-point
Kedar Jadhav to Todd Astle, FOUR, length ball sliding through outside off, Astle slaps it through the covers. The field was up in the ring on that side, and he pierced it through the gap
Kedar Jadhav to Todd Astle, no run, slightly short outside off, Astle cuts it to point
Kedar Jadhav to Santner, 1 run, sliding in on middle with the round arm, Santner makes some room and punches it to long-off
Bhuvneshwar to Todd Astle, no run, back of a length delivery on middle, blunted out by Astle
Bhuvneshwar to Todd Astle, no run, good length ball at the stumps, moves his weight forward in defence
Bhuvneshwar to Todd Astle, no run, good length ball skidding through at middle, blocked to short cover
Bhuvneshwar to Todd Astle, no run, back of a length on off, patted to backward point
Bhuvneshwar to Todd Astle, no run, length ball at the stumps, Astle hangs back to it and turns it to short midwicket
Bhuvneshwar to Santner, 1 run, back of a length delivery outside off, dabs it down to third man
Kedar Jadhav to Todd Astle, no run, flighted delivery wide outside off stump, Astle drives it to cover
Kedar Jadhav to Santner, 1 run, flatter delivery outside off stump, Santner punches it to long-off
Kedar Jadhav to Todd Astle, 1 run, punched down to long-on
Kedar Jadhav to Todd Astle, no run, defended from the crease

Kedar Jadhav to Neesham, out Neesham Run Out!! What on earth was Neesham doing? Presence of mind from MSD and he's run-out. He's celebrating. Firstly this was a huge appeal for LBW, umpire Shaun George shook his head, looked like an inside edge onto thigh pad or even if it didn't take the edge impact was outside off stump. Dhoni was busy appealing, so the ball hit his left leg and rolled back, Neesham was wandering out of the crease for some reason, probably more keen on looking at the umpire than realising he was outside the crease, Dhoni runs back and fires a direct-hit to send back the danger man. Neesham looked like finishing this in 7-8 overs. In fact he was asking Santner for a run when the ball was just a couple of yards away from Dhoni. Didn't know where the ball was. Neesham run out (Dhoni) 44(32) [4s-4 6s-2]
Kedar Jadhav to Santner, 1 run, flatter and short, Santner punches it to long-on

Bhuvneshwar to Neesham, SIX, change of angle from Bhuvneshwar, but it doesn't work. Bowls a juicy length ball on the stumps and Neesham muscles this over square leg, doesn't bother to run. 13 off the over

Bhuvneshwar to Neesham, FOUR, the audacity he has to flick a pace bowler stylishly with a strong bottom hand grip! Wow, that's a great shot, Bhuvi bowls full and on the stumps, Neesham whips the ball literally for a one bounce four through mid-wicket
Bhuvneshwar to Neesham, no run, tries to repeat the steer past point, but picks out the man in the ring
Bhuvneshwar to Neesham, 2 runs, so easily guided with the angle to deep backward point
Bhuvneshwar to Santner, 1 run, fullish and outside off stump, Santner guides it to backward point
Bhuvneshwar to Santner, no run, short of length delivery just outside off stump, Santner defends off the front foot
Shami to Neesham, no run, short of length delivery outside off stump, Neesham defends off the back foot

Shami to Neesham, FOUR, brilliant batting, slower delivery outside off stump, Neesham picked it, delayed the guide, rolled his wrists to keep it along the ground and placed it to the left of backward point

Shami to Neesham, FOUR, pulled to deep mid-wicket, oh Vijay Shankar fumbles, dives and lets this go right through his hands, won't please the bowler. Did the hard work of getting there, but didn't bend enough
Shami to Santner, 1 run, nice back foot punch to deep cover
Shami to Santner, wide, the short ball attempted, way too high and down the leg-side
Shami to Santner, no run, slower delivery outside off stump, Santner tries to defend, gets beaten
Shami to Santner, no run, beaten, this one seemed to have swung away late, excellent take from Dhoni, who was down on one knee, curved late and went awkwardly to the keeper
Hardik Pandya to Santner, 1 run, short of length delivery on the off stump, Santner defends and gets an inside edge to fine leg
Hardik Pandya to Santner, 2 runs, poor line, down the leg-side, Santner flicks it to long leg, Dhoni sends the ball between his legs after collecting but Santner was home
Hardik Pandya to Santner, no run, back of a length and outside off stump, defended
Hardik Pandya to Neesham, 1 run, short of length delivery just outside off stump, Neesham dabs it towards backward point
Hardik Pandya to Neesham, no run, now the off-cutting slower ball bouncer, Neesham lets it pass

Hardik Pandya to Neesham, SIX, nothing full ball, another knuckle ball attempted, the key to bowling knuckle ball is to change the grip last minute but Hardik Pandya showed the grip way too early for the batsman to read it from the hand, Neesham waited and slogged easily over mid-wicket
Hardik Pandya to Neesham, wide, Hardik Pandya tries the knuckle ball but it swings and goes down the leg-side
Chahal to Santner, no run, short delivery outside off stump, Santner tries to punch off the back foot, gets a thick edge that rolls to short third man
Chahal to Neesham, 1 run, googly on the leg stump, Neesham turns it to square leg
Chahal to Santner, 1 run, shortish delivery on the leg stump, Santner punches it to long-on
Chahal to Santner, no run, "nice bowling" says Dhoni as Chahal tosses the ball up and forces Santner to defend off the front foot
Chahal to Santner, no run, flighted delivery on the off stump, Santner defends off the front foot
Chahal to Neesham, 1 run, flighted delivery on the stumps, Neesham goes back and flicks it to mid-wicket
Hardik Pandya to Santner, no run, the attempted short ball isn't as short as it should have been, Santner blocks off the back foot
Hardik Pandya to Santner, 2 runs, edged but there is no one at slip, Hardik Pandya probably got this to tail away late, Santner tries to drive, without moving his feet, got away with the edge
Hardik Pandya to Santner, no run, short of length delivery on the off stump, Santner defends off the back foot
Hardik Pandya to Santner, no run, decent short ball, Santner probably spotted that late, managed to duck under it late
Hardik Pandya to Santner, no run, short delivery outside off stump, Santner lets it pass
Hardik Pandya to Neesham, 1 run, short of length delivery on the off stump, Neesham slogs it to deep mid-wicket

Chahal to de Grandhomme, out Lbw!! Easy decision. Don't review that. In fact he's not even waiting to talk to Neesham. CDG was always vulnerable to the ball that doesn't turn away from him with that big bat-pad gap in his defence, this was the slider that came in with the angle and it struck right in front of middle and off stump. de Grandhomme lbw b Chahal 11(8) [4s-2]
Chahal to Neesham, 1 run, quicker delivery just outside off stump, Neesham rocks back and cuts to cover
Chahal to Neesham, 2 runs, this is down the leg-side, Neesham glances it to fine leg
Chahal to Neesham, no run, another googly on the leg stump, Neesham turns it to mid-wicket
Chahal to Neesham, no run, leg stump googly, Neesham flicks it to backward square leg
Chahal to de Grandhomme, 1 run, flatter delivery on the stumps, de Grandhomme punches it to long-on
Hardik Pandya to de Grandhomme, 1 run, short of length delivery outside off stump, de Grandhomme runs it down to deep backward point
Hardik Pandya to de Grandhomme, FOUR, this is a better shot. Fullish delivery on the leg stump, de Grandhomme flicks over mid-wicket, couple of bounces and into the fence
Hardik Pandya to de Grandhomme, FOUR, he's lofted this in the air knowing long-on is inside the ring, mishit actually but timed it decently enough to get the boundary
Hardik Pandya to de Grandhomme, no run, short of length delivery on the off stump, de Grandhomme defends from the crease
Hardik Pandya to Neesham, 1 run, oh this one skids off the pitch and huries Neesham on the defence, played just in front of the sticks to third man
Hardik Pandya to Neesham, no run, short of length delivery outside off stump, Neesham defends it to backward point
Chahal to de Grandhomme, no run, almost bowled! CDG had no clue about this ball spinning back into him, lunged forward in his defence, ball beat the edge this time and almost shaved the off stump
Chahal to Neesham, 1 run, very full and outside off stump, Neesham drives it to long-off
Chahal to de Grandhomme, 1 run, oh almost through the gate with this googly, lucky edge rolls into the on-side

Chahal to Latham, out Lbw!! That looks plumb. So this is what Dhoni wanted Chahal to do consistently, bowl fuller and make him play the front foot shots. This time Latham got across the line to play the sweep shot, missed it completely and the ball landed in line with leg stump and luckily for Chahal didn't turn as much to miss the leg stump. Latham discussed with Neesham about the review and I reckon it was a good call not to review. That would not be umpire's call. So India have got both the set batsmen! Latham lbw b Chahal 37(49) [4s-3]
Chahal to Latham, no run, another short ball, Latham punches it to the left of the bowler
Chahal to Latham, no run, leg stump line, should have been four, but this is swept straight to short fine leg
Kedar Jadhav to Neesham, FOUR, Kedar tries the yorker again, but misses the mark, lands in the slot for Neesham to slog and he almost flicked that over deep mid-wicket
Kedar Jadhav to Neesham, no run, defended
Kedar Jadhav to Neesham, no run, now the 93kph yorker fired in, Neesham manages to dig it out
Kedar Jadhav to Neesham, 2 runs, another really slow ball, Neesham cuts it to sweeper cover
Kedar Jadhav to Latham, 1 run, slow and teasing at 68kph, you got to be kidding me, Latham waits and slaps it hard to long-off
Kedar Jadhav to Neesham, 1 run, that is a flighted delivery wide outside off stump, Neesham sweeps to deep mid-wicket

Chahal to Latham, FOUR, "Aage se marne do isko (Make him play off the front foot)," shouted Dhoni after the fourth ball, but Chahal drops this short and wide, a happy Latham cuts behind backward point and picks up a boundary
Chahal to Latham, no run, googly and Latham didn't pick it up, read this off the pitch and got a leading edge on the defence
Chahal to Neesham, 1 run, flighted delivery outside off stump, Neesham drives it to long-off
Chahal to Neesham, no run, pushed off the front foot
Chahal to Neesham, no run, defended

Chahal to Neesham, no run, lovely slider from Chahal, Neesham was playing for turn, tried to defend, the ball went past the outside edge, the back foot was on the line, but he managed to just drag it back and land it inside the crease before the bails came off
Kedar Jadhav to Neesham, 1 run, on the leg stump, glanced to backward square leg
Kedar Jadhav to Neesham, no run, flighted delivery on the stumps, Neesham defends

Kedar Jadhav to Williamson, out Caught by Dhawan!! How many times has Kedar Jadhav broken a big stand? He's showing his dance moves and look at MSD, celebrating with his arms pointing up. Was there a plan? Couldn't pick up much from the stump mics. So with his seriously teasing and irritating slingly bowling action to batsmen, Kedar tempts Williamson with a short ball, the New Zealand skipper wanted to power this pull shot over the rope, but no pace was offered on the ball by the bowler, so in trying to generate some he holed out at deep mid-wicket. Williamson c Dhawan b Kedar Jadhav 39(73) [4s-3]
Kedar Jadhav to Williamson, no run, now he bowls the next ball slower through the air and a bit round-armish as well, Williamson cuts it into the off-side
Kedar Jadhav to Williamson, no run, the yorker pushed through at 93kph, Williamson just digs it out
Kedar Jadhav to Latham, 1 run, flighted delivery on the stumps, Latham drives it gently to long-on after using the feet
Chahal to Williamson, no run, flatter and on the stumps, defended straight back to the bowler
Chahal to Williamson, no run, spins away and takes the outside edge but Williamson played with soft hands, so it rolls along the ground to short third man
Chahal to Latham, 1 run, nicely swept away as Chahal gives this a lot of air, hit to deep backward square leg
Chahal to Williamson, 1 run, fullish and outside off stump, Williamson drives it to long-off
Chahal to Latham, 1 run, short and on the stumps, flicked to deep backward square leg
Chahal to Williamson, 1 run, flighted delivery on the stumps, knocked down to long-on
Kedar Jadhav to Williamson, 1 run, pushed to long-off and New Zealand raise their hundred, that wakes up the crowd at the Cake Tin
Kedar Jadhav to Latham, 1 run, shortish delivery, Latham turns it to deep square leg
Kedar Jadhav to Williamson, 1 run, gently driven along the carpet to long-on
Kedar Jadhav to Williamson, no run, oh slower through the air and Williamson chips a return catch almost, Kedar dives to his right and stops the ball
Kedar Jadhav to Williamson, no run, stays leg-side to cut this flat delivery, but can't get it past cover-point
Kedar Jadhav to Latham, 1 run, flighted delivery on the stumps, Latham steps out and flicks along the ground to deep backward square leg
Chahal to Latham, 1 run, flighted delivery down the leg-side, Latham sweeps it to deep backward square leg
Chahal to Williamson, 1 run, flicked away nicely to long-on
Chahal to Williamson, no run, flighted delivery on the stumps, Williamson defends off the front foot
Chahal to Latham, 1 run, flighted delivery on the stumps, Latham flicks it to deep mid-wicket
Chahal to Williamson, 1 run, driven down to long-on
Chahal to Latham, 1 run, worked it away to backward square leg
Kedar Jadhav to Williamson, 2 runs, floated up on middle and leg, wristed away past the diving mid-wicket fielder. Well wide of the man in the deep and they get two
Kedar Jadhav to Latham, 1 run, use of the feet this time by Latham as he punches it past the diving mid-wicket fielder who can't get a hand on it. Down to long-on
Kedar Jadhav to Williamson, 1 run, tries to get too ambitious with the away curler and spills it down leg, swept away down to fine leg
Kedar Jadhav to Williamson, no run, floated up around middle and off, defended softly towards cover
Kedar Jadhav to Latham, 1 run, round-armish on a good length, Latham waitd and punched it to sweeper cover
Kedar Jadhav to Williamson, 1 run, very full and outside off, drilled hard off the front foot but Hardik does well at extra cover to get a hand on it. Deflects it down to long-off
Chahal to Latham, no run, slightly short and wider outside off, stabbed off the back foot towards mid-wicket
Chahal to Latham, 2 runs, drifting in on the pads, Latham gets across a bit and flicks it away through backward square leg. Easy two
Chahal to Latham, no run, tossed up leg break, worked softly off the front foot to mid-wicket
Chahal to Williamson, 1 run, slows it down around off, no room as Williamson punches this to cover. Brisk single
Chahal to Williamson, no run, very full and around middle, pushed firmly back to the bowler
Chahal to Latham, 1 run, slips it around leg stump, worked away off the back foot to deep square leg
Kedar Jadhav to Latham, 1 run, flatter and shorter outside off, whipped off the back foot down to long-on
Kedar Jadhav to Williamson, 1 run, tossed up generously, very full and driven towards extra cover
Kedar Jadhav to Williamson, wide, harsh call I guess! Drifted away from Williamson who went for the cut but got beaten
Kedar Jadhav to Williamson, no run, another slow slinger with a bit of flight, punched to mid-off where there is a fumble. The batsmen had a mix uo again but this time, quickly abort the single
Kedar Jadhav to Latham, 1 run, slings this in on a fuller length, driven down the ground to long-off
Kedar Jadhav to Williamson, 1 run, fuller and on leg stump, paddled away down towards fine leg

Kedar Jadhav to Williamson, no run, nearly a run out! Would have been a crazy dismissal but Jadhav can't hit the stumps at the bowler's end. Was worked to mid-wicket and Rohit quickly threw it towards the bowler sensing Latham's anxiousness for a single
Chahal to Latham, no run, spins in a bit from around middle and leg, tucked off the back foot to short fine leg
Chahal to Latham, no run, fuller and around off, slower in pace too as Latham nudges it to mid-wicket
Chahal to Latham, FOUR, poor ball and it's bashed! Half tracker and Latham sits back to nail the pull to perfection. Ensured that he got it between deep backward square leg and deep mid-wicket
Chahal to Williamson, 1 run, skids through from around leg stump, punched down the ground to long-on
Chahal to Latham, 1 run, slightly shorter around off, worked off the back foot to deep mid-wicket
Chahal to Latham, no run, floated up outside off, punched off the back foot to cover
Shankar to Williamson, no run, angling into Williamson from around middle, straighter lines and he tucks this towards mid-on
Shankar to Williamson, no run, nips back in a fraction from around off, Williamson adjusts with a jab towards mid-on
Shankar to Latham, 1 run, short of a good length outside off, punched off the back foot to sweeper cover
Shankar to Williamson, 1 run, comes in from a good length, faint inside edge onto the pads as the ball goes towards the vacant short fine leg region

Shankar to Williamson, FOUR, this is an even better stroke! This might just get KW going. Overpitched from Shankar and it's stroked straight down the ground past the bowler. Well to the left of mid-on and it races to the fence. Back to back boundaries for the skipper

Shankar to Williamson, FOUR, probably the best shot Williamson has played today! Slightly short and wide as well, he sits back and cuts it hard wide of backward point. Beautiful connection and third man had no chance
Hardik Pandya to Williamson, 1 run, another inside edge that misses the sticks! Was quite close to Williamson as he tried to run this down to third man, dragged it towards backward square leg
Hardik Pandya to Latham, 1 run, walks down the track to work this on the leg-side but gets it off the leading edge towards deep point
Hardik Pandya to Latham, no run, shortish and angling across Latham who steers this towards point where Jaddu is prowling
Hardik Pandya to Latham, no run, on a good length around off, gets a thick inside edge onto the pad and it trickles towards cover

Hardik Pandya to Latham, FOUR, superb ball but an even better shot! Late inswing on this one, quite full and Latham did well not to overbalance himself as he wristed this past the bowler. Beautifully timed and beat mid-on with ease. Top shot!
Hardik Pandya to Latham, no run, fuller and around off, worked with a closed bat face to mid-wicket
Shankar to Williamson, no run, fuller this time, around off and it's patted back down the track

Shankar to Williamson, 2 runs, fractionally short and Williamson stands tall to crunch this through point. Timed well but Rayudu at sweeper once again does good work. Puts in a good slide to save a brace
Shankar to Williamson, no run, back of a length around middle and leg, worked off the back foot towards mid-wicket
Shankar to Latham, 1 run, down the pitch goes Latham and punches this towards sweeper cover. You can afford to do this at Shankar's pace and perhaps it could be a case for MS to stand upto the stumps
Shankar to Williamson, 1 run, charges down the track for the lofted hit inside out but slices it aerially over point. Rayudu at sweeper comes around rapidly to keep the batsmen to just a single
Shankar to Latham, 1 run, quite full and outside off, dabbed towards cover and they steal a single. They're picking the fielders well on these singles
Hardik Pandya to Williamson, no run, back of a length outside off, worked softly from the crease towards mid-on

Hardik Pandya to Williamson, no run, muted LBW appeal! Dies down instantly as the Indians feel there was a faint inside edge there. They're right. Was a lovely nipbacker from Hardik and Williamson was struggled around his front pad today. Survives for now
Hardik Pandya to Williamson, no run, the hard length, just outside off and defended softly towards backward point

Hardik Pandya to Williamson, FOUR, top edge flies over Dhoni! Finally, Williamson has a boundary to his name but I don't think he'll be confident of this stroke. Was hurried on the surprise short ball and didn't connect the pull well at all
Hardik Pandya to Williamson, no run, good length just outside off, punched back towards the bowler

Hardik Pandya to Latham, 1 run, direct hit and Williamson was nowhere in the frame! Unfortunately, Shankar misses. Probably had more time than he thought and threw in haste. This was stabbed to point where he made a good stop and the run was always risky. In the end, the wayward throw saves KW
Shankar to Latham, 1 run, shortish and wider outside off, punched off the back foot to deep point
Shankar to Latham, no run, length ball on leg stump, tucked softly towards mid-wicket
Shankar to Latham, no run, on a good length outside off, punched off the front foot to short cover
Shankar to Williamson, 1 run, back of a length outside off, crunched off the back foot to deep point

Shankar to Williamson, no run, very full and around middle, driven back at Shankar who gets a hand on it, almost deflected it to the stumps at the bowler's end but missed. Latham thought of the single but had to rush back as Chahal came charging in from mid-wicket
Shankar to Williamson, no run, fuller and outside off, Williamson drives firmly back to the bowler
Hardik Pandya to Latham, no run, fuller and around middle, flicked well but finds the mid-wicket fielder

Hardik Pandya to Latham, no run, another near drag on! Quite a few today, tells you about the two-paced nature of this pitch. Close to the off pole and Latham wanted to get it square through the off-side, gets an inside edge just past leg stump
Hardik Pandya to Williamson, 1 run, this was close! Fullish inswinger, heading towards the pads and Williamson had to connect the flick, which he did. Gets it to the right of Chahal at mid-on
Hardik Pandya to Williamson, no run, on a length angling in from outside off, defended well from the crease
Hardik Pandya to Williamson, no run, very full and angling in from outside off, nudged with soft hands towards gully

Hardik Pandya to Latham, 1 run, run out chance but Chahal doesn't gather it cleanly! Was driven firmly towards him at mid-off and the batsmen went for the risky single. Latham would have been in trouble for sure if there was a direct hit
Shankar to Williamson, no run, fuller and outside off, driven firmly back to the bowler
Shankar to Latham, 1 run, walks across quite a bit and glances this down to fine leg. Would have been a goner if he missed this
Shankar to Latham, no run, the hard length around off, Latham is on the move as he defends this towards cover
Shankar to Latham, no run, pitched up and holds its line a bit to square Latham up, patted to cover
Shankar to Williamson, 1 run, fuller and wider outside off, driven through the covers for a single
Shankar to Williamson, no run, on a length outside off, defended towards the point fielder
Hardik Pandya to Latham, no run, on a length outside off, punched off the front foot to mid-off
Hardik Pandya to Latham, no run, fuller and around off, Latham gets across and defends it well
Hardik Pandya to Latham, no run, back of a length outside off, Latham doesn't offer a stroke
Hardik Pandya to Latham, no run, on a length around off stump, Latham stays back and defends it well

Hardik Pandya to Ross Taylor, out Lbw!! Hardik strikes a massive blow! Just two deliveries for the all-rounder to get into the act. Was the fizzing nipbacker and Taylor was stuck on the crease as he tried to play around the front pad. Couldn't make contact and that was a rather easy decision for the umpire. Taylor did have a chat with Williamson before walking off. Perhaps not confident enough to review it. India firmly on top with this wicket. Ross Taylor lbw b Hardik Pandya 1(4)
Hardik Pandya to Ross Taylor, no run, fuller and closer to off stump, defended well off the front foot
Shami to Williamson, no run, back of a length, climbs off the pitch and Williamson mistimes the punch towards cover. He's struggling to get his timing going
Shami to Williamson, no run, pitched up outside off, drives with hard hands and gets a thick inside edge onto the pad
Shami to Williamson, no run, full and curving in a bit, Williamson works it softly towards mid-wicket
Shami to Ross Taylor, 1 run, short of a length, wider lines and Taylor cuts it away down to third man to open his account
Shami to Ross Taylor, no run, fuller and outside off, Taylor drives this back towards the bowler

Shami to Munro, out Bowled!! Drags this onto the stumps! Munro finally runs out of luck and has to go. Shami has his second. Was a short of a length delivery that skid off the track, not the kind of pitch where you can stand and deliver the cut stroke but that's precisely what Munro tries. Goes real hard with no foot movement and can only inside edge this onto the sticks. Excellent first Powerplay so far for India. Munro b Shami 24(19) [4s-2 6s-1]
Bhuvneshwar to Williamson, no run, fuller and closer to off, defended off the front foot towards point
Bhuvneshwar to Munro, 1 run, full and angling in from around off, clipped away in front of square through the leg-side
Bhuvneshwar to Munro, no run, short of a good length and Munro wants to heave it away. Doesn't connect

Bhuvneshwar to Munro, 2 runs, another mishit, lands safe! Munro is living adventurously. Comes down the track for a straight loft but miscues it horribly. Uppish but manages to clear a backtrekking mid-off fielder, goes over him

Bhuvneshwar to Munro, FOUR, in the air but Munro has picked his spot! Probably a touch too straight in line and he launched it on the leg-side. Aerial alright and not off the middle either but he splits deep backward square leg and deep mid-wicket
Bhuvneshwar to Munro, no run, back of a length around off, cramps Munro for room and he adjusts with a punch to mid-off
Shami to Williamson, no run, back of a length outside off, stabbed off the back foot towards cover
Shami to Williamson, no run, fuller and just outside off, solidly defended off the front foot towards point
Shami to Williamson, no run, fuller this time, tempting the drive but Williamson is content with easing it to mid-off
Shami to Williamson, no run, shortish and skids through from outside off, Williamson is slightly off balance as he punches this to cover
Shami to Williamson, no run, fuller and outside off, blocked off the front foot towards point
Shami to Munro, 1 run, good stop by Rohit with a dive at cover. This sounded great off the bat, a crunchy back foot punch from Munro but will only get himself a single
Bhuvneshwar to Williamson, no run, back of a length and Williamson stands tall to punch this towards point
Bhuvneshwar to Munro, 1 run, the knuckle ball, on a good length and Munro was probably surprised by it. Inside edges this towards mid-wicket
Bhuvneshwar to Munro, no run, good change of pace, saw Munro backing away and delivered an off cutter. Goes off the outside edge towards the short third man fielder who is a touch finer
Bhuvneshwar to Munro, no run, good response from Bhuvi, fine yorker around off and it's dug out to point

Bhuvneshwar to Munro, FOUR, told ya! He ain't gonna die wondering. In the slot around off, Munro just clears his front leg and clobbers this over mid-wicket after taking a couple of steps down the track. This should be an interesting over
Bhuvneshwar to Munro, no run, probes away around the off pole on a good length, Munro pats this towards cover

Shami to Williamson, no run, muted LBW appeal that dies down rather instantly. A tad too high as this struck Williamson near the thigh area. Was the nipbacker from Shami and pinned Williamson on the crease as he tried to work across the line
Shami to Williamson, no run, angling in from outside off, Williamson moves forward and blocks it towards cover

Shami to Williamson, 2 runs, almost chopped onto the sticks! Near replica of KW's dismissal in the first ODI except that he didn't get bowled. Short of a length and seaming into him, he tried the cut stroke and got a thick inside edge that just missed leg stump down to fine leg. Come to think of it, the bowler was Shami in that game too
Shami to Williamson, no run, fourth stump line on a length, dabbed with soft hands towards gully

Shami to Williamson, no run, slight excitement for LBW but a faint inside edge onto the pad there. Nipbacker from Shami and Williamson was rooted on the crease as he looked to defend around the front pad
Shami to Williamson, no run, fuller and angling in on off, solidly blocked from the crease

Bhuvneshwar to Williamson, 1 run, gets it past that diving gully fielder this time! Was on a good length and Williamson just opened his bat face to beat his counterpart who tried hard to prevent the single
Bhuvneshwar to Williamson, no run, fuller and closer to off, angling into Williamson who defends down the track

Bhuvneshwar to Williamson, no run, stays really low! Williamson is lucky that this wasn't straighter in line as it could have crashed into the timber. Was angled into him from around off, straightened just a tad and shot through low past the blade. On the bounce to Dhoni

Bhuvneshwar to Williamson, no run, on a length around the fourth stump line, nervous dab from Williamson and he finds that gully fielder who is placed for this shot. Remember he nicked off to the keeper last game trying this shot
Bhuvneshwar to Williamson, no run, shortish and outside off, Williamson stands tall and defends this towards cover
Bhuvneshwar to Munro, 1 run, gives the charge does Munro and goes through with the pull shot but this fizzes from a shortish length to catch the cue end of the blade. Dribbles to deep mid-wicket
Shami to Williamson, 2 runs, a touch fuller and Williamson drives it through the gap at extra cover. Mid-off chases it down
Shami to Williamson, no run, back of a length around middle and off, Williamson stands tall to defend
Shami to Williamson, no run, full and closer to off stump, Williamson defends with soft hands towards the slip cordon

Shami to Henry Nicholls, out Caught by Kedar Jadhav!! There's the early wicket India were searching for. Shami provides it with a short ball that skidded on after pitching. Nicholls was clearly late on the pull and didn't bother keeping it down either. Mistimed it towards mid-on where Jadhav took a sharp catch. It was travelling flat at him and by his standards, it's definitely a very good catch. Not sure Nicholls should have tried this shot though with Munro there at the other end. Henry Nicholls c Kedar Jadhav b Shami 8(15) [4s-1]
Shami to Henry Nicholls, no run, that was there to be hit but Nicholls can't pick the gap. Short and wide, slaps the cut hard but straight to Shanker at backward point

Shami to Henry Nicholls, no run, this has clocked 144kph! Shortish and skidding in from outside off, Nicholls is hurried by the pace as he defends this from the crease. Off the bottom edge towards Dhoni
Bhuvneshwar to Munro, no run, very full and outside off, looks to drive with hard hands and gets a thick inside edge onto the pad

Bhuvneshwar to Munro, SIX, such a clean bat swing! He's just fresh off a fine knock in the Super Smash yesterday and that form is certainly showing in this shot. Fuller length from Bhuvneshwar and it's been picked up over deep mid-wicket with a clean hoick, lovely hitting
Bhuvneshwar to Henry Nicholls, 1 run, quick single. Nicholls hangs back and punches this in front of mid-on. Judged the run perfectly there and got good response from Munro
Bhuvneshwar to Henry Nicholls, no run, angling across Nicholls this time, on a good length outside off and left alone
Bhuvneshwar to Henry Nicholls, no run, another sharp nipbacker from Bhuvi, pitched around middle and leg, jagged back to rap Nicholls on the back thigh
Bhuvneshwar to Henry Nicholls, no run, shapes in from a good length, Nicholls shuffles on the back foot and gets a faint inside edge onto the pad

Shami to Henry Nicholls, 1 run, nearly a run out chance! Terrific effort from Shanker, dived to his left at point to make a half stop to save a boundary. He couldn't gather it cleanly quickly enough because the batsmen were having a mix up and a run out was a real possibility. Good shot to start with from Nicholls again, cut it well off the front foot

Shami to Henry Nicholls, FOUR, classy shot! If Munro is about power, Nicholls prefers to time them. This was not all that full but he got across on the front foot and eased the straight drive past the diving mid-off fielder
Shami to Henry Nicholls, no run, on a length wider outside off, Nicholls sits back and shoulders arms

Shami to Henry Nicholls, 2 runs, thick inside edge! Skiddy good of a length delivery, angling into Nicholls who was late on the defensive push. Nearly chopped on, as the ball whizzes past the leg stump towards fine leg. Chahal was squarer and got around in time
Shami to Henry Nicholls, no run, slanting in from a good length, just outside off and Nicholls stands tall to defend. A bit of extra bounce
Shami to Munro, 1 run, angles it in on a good length and Munro wanted to heave this away. Drags it off the inside edge well wide of the mid-on fielder
Bhuvneshwar to Henry Nicholls, no run, skids through a touch low from a good length, hurried Nicholls into the defensive push and went off the bottom edge towards MS
Bhuvneshwar to Henry Nicholls, no run, fuller and closer to off stump, blocked off the front foot towards cover
Bhuvneshwar to Henry Nicholls, no run, shapes away from a good length outside off, left alone to the keeper
Bhuvneshwar to Munro, 1 run, fuller and outside off, Munro drives this towards mid-off where Rohit slips badly. Hopefully he isn't serious
Bhuvneshwar to Munro, 2 runs, mishit but clears mid-off! Munro wanted to launch this down the ground, couldn't get hold of it properly and skewed it over the infield
Bhuvneshwar to Munro, no run, angling in on off, Munro shuffles a bit and defends it down the track
